column2: A jQuery plugin that enables HTML5 placeholder behavior for browsers that aren’t trying hard enough yet

column5: message
Update QUnit.js

exclude [type="hidden"] not :hidden

fixes #283

Merge pull request #279 from mathiasbynens/master

Master

Merge pull request #278 from mathiasbynens/gh-pages

merging to master
bumped version

fix to prevent javascript:void(0) anchors breaking placeholders in IE

- fixes  #74
- fix to prevent javascript:void(0) anchors breaking placeholders in
IE. javascript:void(0) causes beforeunload to fire off causing the
plugin to clear placeholders. We try to check to see if
javascript:void(0) is being used by calling document.activeElement

Remove moot `version` property from bower.json

Remove moot `version` property from bower.json

Per bower/bower.json-spec@a325da3

Fixes password placeholder appearing as bullets

- When running emulation (ie7/8/9) mode in a modern IE it would cause
the password placeholder to appear as bullets rather than text. Thanks
Alex Chao

Fix the password dot problem in IE7/8 simulated by IE9+
Fix the password dot problem in IE7/8 simulated by IE9+

Fix triggering blur event mununally
Updated
convert tabs to spaces

dependency -> peerDependency

minified latest

Custom class fix

Removed checking for the 'placeholder' class to support using a custom class

Add copyright icon like jQuery (http://cdn.jsdelivr.net/jquery/latest/jquery.min.js):
© => (c)

updated bower.json details

=== for string compare. no need to store $.fn

- Added triple === for string comparisons where needed
- Don’t really need to store $.fn in a variable, it’s only used twice,
this change will make it less confusing
Make selector more specific for password fields

Only include bower.json and jquery.placeholder.js in our bower package

Users of this package don't need our tests, README, etc.

Tag the v2.0.8 release

Closes #190.

Fix detection for Opera Mini

Opera Mini v7 doesn’t support `placeholder` although its DOM seems to indicate so. To work around this, there’s no other way than UA sniffing, sadly :(

Fixes #173. Closes #130.

Merge pull request #183 from yannickoo/master

Fix the link to the v1.8.7 in README.md

Avoid IE9 errors when accessing `document.activeElement`

https://github.com/mathiasbynens/jquery-placeholder/pull/99#issuecomment-25535993

Closes #99 and #161.

Add `.prop('placeholder')` tests (failing for now)

These tests describe the functionality that #145 is asking for.

Closes #147.

Delete unused variable `$origInput`

Closes #131.
Add unit tests

Remove GPL license

MIT is GPL-compatible anyway.

Merge pull request #143 from benschwarz/bower

Add `bower.json`

Merge pull request #95 from thebestday/prop-hooks

Hook into property values through `$.propHooks`
Added some notes about bower to the readme
Added bower.json
README: Fix typo

Hook into property values.

Makes setting and getting a form field's value property with `jQuery#prop`
behave the same as `jQuery#val`.

Libraries like bootstrap-datepicker use `jQuery#prop`.

Merge pull request #73 from dsgh/patch-1

Use ASCII only for compatibility with crappy build scripts and frameworks
Use ascii single quote as apostrophe instead of unicode's right single quotation mark

Fix regression where password placeholders get displayed as text in Firefox 3.5

Closes #72.

Make sure the input cursor doesn’t disappear when moving the focus to a blank input field in IE8

Fixes #67.
Fix a typo that caused chaining to break in some cases
Tag the v2.0.4 release

Merge pull request #57 from sbull/empty-string-val-issue-56

Don’t `setPlaceholder` if the element has focus

Fixes #56.
Don't setPlaceholder if the element has focus. Fixes #56.
Typo
Tag the 2.0.2 release

Merge pull request #54 from sbull/valHooks-only-if-enabled

Avoid calling placeholder functions in valHooks unless .placeholder() ha...
Avoid calling placeholder functions in valHooks unless .placeholder() has been invoked on the element.

Use the `beforeunload` event rather than `unload`

Fixes #35.

Make `.val()` work as expected

* Use `jQuery.valHooks` to make sure `.val()` and `.val(value)` work as expected. Avoid using `.val()` internally. This fixes #30.
* Tweak the syntax a bit here and there now that we’ve dropped support for pre-1.6 jQueries.

Make submit handler work for dynamically inserted forms

Fixes #41. This plugin now requires jQuery 1.4.2 (since we’re using `jQuery#delegate`).
Tag the v1.8.6 release

Allow calling `.placeholder()` more than once on the same element

Fixes #43.
Don’t require an id attribute for password fields. Fixes #34.
Get rid of an unused argument in `setPlaceholder()`. Also, shorten the header comment a bit.
Use `* eol=lf` instead of `* crlf=input`.
Add syntax highlighting to the README.
Don’t do anything on DOMContentLoaded if placeholder is natively supported anyway.
Fix Markdown formatting in README.
Correct a typo in the README. Fixes #26.
Tweak README.
Update the demo so it shows that <label> elements will now work properly for password inputs in browsers that require an extra input field to fake the placeholder.
Avoid duplicate IDs for password inputs. Fixes #9.
Expose `jQuery.fn.placeholder.input` and `jQuery.fn.placeholder.textarea`. Fixes #15.
Allow the user to enter values that are equal to the placeholder value. Fixes #1.
Added Opera 11.00 to the list of browsers that support input/@placeholder but not support textarea/@placeholder.
Small README update.
Adding GPL and MIT licenses.
Update minified version
Resolves an issue with password inputs in IE6 and IE7. Patched by temp01. Fixes #12.
Handle browsers that support @placeholder for <input> but not for <textarea> (like Safari 4) correctly.
Added link to online demo to demo.html
We don’t want to stop the plugin after event.preventDefault() in a submit handler. Fixes #5.
Added demo.html
Updated minified version to reflect temp01’s awesome changes
Optimization, better arguments copying for password inputs, jQuery 1.3 compatibility and more!
Some more optimizations thanks to my -ot homies
Switched to namespaced events. Rewrote/optimized some other stuff too. Much ♥ to Sean Koole and temp01!
Return early if the element doesn’t have a placeholder attribute specified. Thanks for the tip, @gpupo!
Added cross-browser support for type=password, based on sidonath’s fork.
Updated readme to show the plugin works with textareas as well. Clear textarea values upon page reload
Wrap class="placeholder" in a code block
Use `:submit` instead of `input[type=submit]`
Apply the click handler on the submit button instead of the entire form
Bug fix
Focus only the first input[placeholder] upon invalid submit. Fixes issue #1.
Remove placeholder class inside the setPlaceholder() function
Also set the placeholder class in case the input’s value equals the placeholder on page load (e.g. when reloading the page in browsers who remember form data)
Updated readme
Added class="placeholder" to elements currently showing their placeholder text
Initial commit
